documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: well , it 's goodnight from the team at bbc norfolk local live for this week .
we hope you 'll join us again on monday at 08:00 , for the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
before we go , here 's a recap of some of the stories making the news in norfolk today :
scroll down for more and have a great weekend .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: ladies take on league leaders
text: harleston magpies put their unbeaten home record on the line in hockey 's conference east this weekend .
the south norfolk women play league leaders wimbledon at weybread .
they 're fourth in the table with three matches left to play .
`` you always want to play the best teams and at home we are undefeated .
they 've shown they 're not unbeatable . ''
said magpies coach rob sorrell .

BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: sea defence work starts between snettisham and hunstanton
text: work begins today on sea defences between snettisham and hunstanton .
it 's annual work , but this year they 're also dealing with the fall-out of storm doris which caused about £ 8,000 worth of damage .
this is the first year the work is being funded locally instead of being paid for by the environment agency .

it will also be very mild , with lows of 7c ( 45f ) .

documents.title: helpers sought to protect terns nesting on norfolk beaches
text: the rspb is looking for people to help protect rare birds nesting on the coast .
little terns have for years colonised the beaches of great yarmouth , winterton and sea palling .

but in recent years their numbers have declined even further , and the bird protection charity says , even though it 's spent 30 years working on little tern habitats , it needs more help from the public .
daniel hercock , from the rspb , said : `` we have a pretty good blueprint on how to protect them , but we need people on the ground to help protect them as the project goes forward .
`` the terns do nest on open beaches , and beaches are popular with people , so they are susceptible to disturbance .
`` they are also susceptible to predation from , for example , foxes . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: mother pays tribute to son who died in fincham grain silo accident
text: the mother of a 21-year-old student who died after sinking into a grain silo on his father 's farm and suffocating has paid paid tribute to a song who was `` larger than life , fun loving '' .
arthur mason was working for his father hugh mason , at the family firm maurice mason in fincham , near downham market , in july 2014
the firm was fined £ 50,000 today after admitting breaches of health and safety law .
arthur mason 's mother kay mason billig said his son 's `` death has affected so many people , his family , his friends and his colleagues '' .
`` farming accidents and accidents of this type involving enclosed spaces are alarmingly common , '' she said .
`` i urge farmers to take note of this verdict today and look hard at their safety procedures .
`` no one should have to lose their life in such a preventable accident . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: one from the archives : church trial of stiffkey rector harold davidson
text: some 85 years ago this month `` prostitutes ' padre '' harold davidson ( 1875-1937 ) , rector of stiffkey in norfolk , with his daughter patricia , were photographed after a church disciplinary trial at church house , westminster , london .
davidson was charged with immoral conduct in connection with his work with prostitutes and the case resulted in davidson being defrocked later that year .
but in .
2004 bbc inside out .

presented evidence that cast doubt on his conviction , including letters between davidson and the star prosecution witness gwendoline harris ( known as barbara harris ) , arriving at church house , which suggest the relationship was not improper .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: grain silo death farm fined £ 50,000 for health and safety breaches
text: a firm has been fined £ 50,000 after admitting breaches of health and safety law when a man died by sinking into a grain silo at his father 's farm and suffocating .
arthur mason , 21 , was working for his father hugh mason , at the family firm maurice mason in fincham , near downham market , in july 2014 .
he was cleaning the silo when he fell in .
hugh mason 's lawyer mark ballysz , told norwich crown court no level of sentence could add to the punishment he has already suffered .
the health and safety executive told the court how silo cleaning had been behind schedule at hall farm .
arthur mason was wearing a safety lanyard designed to break a fall from height as he worked inside the grain-filled drum .
but as he stood on the grain , a valve was released and he sank into the grain , with the lanyard extended to twice its original length , failing to stop his descent .
norwich crown court heard how grain acts like quicksand when a silo is emptied from below and once trapped it 's impossible to self-rescue .
another worker climbed in to try and rescue him , but was unsuccessful and a hammer was used to break an access panel in the silo in an attempt to help the 21-year-old .
but when emergency services , who were on the scene within 10 minutes , freed him , attempts to revive him failed and he was pronounced dead .
the firm maurice mason was also ordered to pay costs of £ 22,000 .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: queen elizabeth hospital appeal after a & e spike in demand
text: the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn has called for people to first contact a health advice line after a spike in the numbers attending its accident and emergency department .
the hospital 's chief operating officer karen croker said : `` in recent days , the hospital has seen a significant number of very frail and seriously ill patients requiring acute medical treatment .
`` we are working closely with our partners in the health and social care system to ensure we proactively manage this spike in demand .

`` while we would never deter anyone from seeking medical treatment , we would ask the public to help our staff during this busy period by first contacting nhs 111 for advice before setting out for a & e . ''
advice can also be found on the internet by visiting .
www.nhs.uk/staywell .
or the choose me , not a & e website .

ms croker added : we also ask that people who have experienced diarrhoea or vomiting in the past 48 hours refrain from visiting the hospital unless it is a medical emergency to help prevent norovirus . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: canaries press call : 'crazy ' position ahead of rovers ' visit
text: norwich city are holding their regular friday press conference ahead of tomorrow 's visit of blackburn rovers .
the visitors are two points above the relegation zone , while the canaries are nine points outside the championship 's play-off places .
ivo pinto said : `` if you said we would be in this position before the season started , i would say you were crazy . ''
ivo pinto says he 's just focussing on himself and how he can improve and therefore improve the team .

goalkeeper mcgovern returned to the canaries first team for the 1-1 draw at bristol city on tuesday , while striker lafferty has n't started a league game all season .

documents.title: norfolk and norwich festival artistic director 's 'brilliant adventure '
text: the artistic director of the norfolk and norwich festival , who has announced he is to step down , has spoken of how running the event has been a `` brilliant adventure '' .
the board of norfolk and norwich festival has thanked william galinsky ( for helping `` to establish the festival as a world class event '' .

mr galinsky said : `` after seven festivals , 60 world premieres , 124 new commissions , 40 festival co-productions and 2,143 individual performances i have decided it 's time to catch my breath and 2017 will be my norfolk and norwich festival swan song .
`` being artistic director has been the most brilliant adventure - at times , it has made me feel like willy wonka .

`` from wildwork 's wolf 's child in the forests of felbrigg hall , to a cardboard st peter mancroft built by thousands of volunteers , the festival has given me the opportunity to bring the audiences experiences beyond an artistic director 's wildest dreams .

`` seven festivals have gone in a flash and none of it would have been possible without the amazing festival team , our army of wonderful volunteers , the wisdom and support of the nnf board , the faith of arts council england and norwich city council , and all of our friends , supporters and sponsors and , perhaps most importantly of all , the enthusiasm of our audiences . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: artistic director of norfolk and norwich festival to step down
text: the artistic director of the norfolk and norwich festival has announced he is to step down at the end of this year 's festival in may .
william galinsky has been in charge of the event for seven years .
the chairwoman of the festival , brenda arthur , said : `` as a result of william 's work norfolk and norwich festival is now regarded as one of the top four arts festivals in the country .
`` the board looks forward to building on the success of the festival , increasing inclusivity and accessibility , working with local communities and encouraging more young local talent .
`` william has grown the festival so that we now have a solid base from which to look to the future .
`` as such we have to thank him for all he has achieved and wish him every success in his next venture . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: 'systemic failure ' after teenager drowned on day out while in care
text: we reported earlier that a firm had been ordered to pay £ 100,000 after a 16-year-old boy in its care drowned at an old sand quarry at bawsey pits near king 's lynn .
castle homes limited , which ran castle lodge home for young people in cambridgeshire , admitted breaching health and safety regulations .
outlining the prosecution case , quentin hunt said employees of the home had taken boys on a trip to bawsey pits near king 's lynn on 16 july 2013 .
the staff made no efforts to stop umar balogun , 16 , and another boy from getting into the water even though there were a number of `` no swimming '' signs .
mr hunt said : `` mr balogun was seen to duck under the water and did not reappear .
`` mr balogun may have got caught out by the changing depth .
he subsequently became entangled in weeds and drowned .
`` a diver was sent to the scene and subsequently recovered the body . ''
castle lodge offered one-to-one care of youngsters who `` showed signs of sexually inappropriate behaviour '' , the court heard .
mr hunt , for the health and safety executive , said that while there were `` generic risk assessments '' , individual assessments were not made for trips like the one to the pits .
the lawyer said there was `` systemic failure '' at castle lodge which went on over a `` long period '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: firm fined £ 100,000 after drowning in norfolk pit
text: a firm has been ordered to pay £ 100,000 after a 16-year-old boy in its care drowned on a trip to an old sand quarry in norfolk .
castle homes limited , which ran the castle lodge home for young people in cambridgeshire , admitted breaching health and safety regulations over the incident in july 2013 .

two support workers also faced charges over the death of umar balogun , from waltham forest , north-east london , at bawsey pits near king 's lynn , but were cleared following a trial at king 's lynn crown court .
at the old bailey , judge mark dennis qc ordered castle homes to pay a fine of £ 80,000 and £ 20,000 prosecution costs to the health and safety executive .
he said the death exposed `` flaws in the system '' as well as `` obvious errors '' on the day , including failing to make a risk assessment for the trip .
both staff members who went on the trip were `` raw recruits '' when there was another more experienced person who could have gone , he said .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: breaking firm ordered to pay £ 100,000 after teenager drowned at bawsey pits
text: a firm has been ordered to pay £ 100,000 after a 16-year-old boy in its caredrowned on a trip to bawsey pits near king 's lynn .
castle homes limited , which ran castle lodge home for young people , in cambridgeshire , admitted breaching health and safety regulations over the incident in july 2013 .

documents.title: academy boss says 'do n't rule out grammar schools '
text: the boss of a chain of academy schools in norfolk and suffolk says we should consider the idea of opening new grammar schools here .
dame rachel de souza , who .

heads the inspiration trust which runs 13 academies and free schools in norwich , great yarmouth , lowestoft , thetford and cromer , said any new policy which could improve education for children in the county should be closely examined .
`` with pupils who are out in the coastal areas where there are high levels of deprivation it is an absolute fight to get a great education , '' she said .
`` if we can make it better using whatever new policy comes in , for these pupils , i think it is our duty to look at it .
`` we 'd be mad not too . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: darts : wright 's fine form continues
text: suffolk 's new uk open champion peter wright beat james wade 7-5 in the premier league in glasgow last night .
phil taylor 's defeat to adrian lewis means wright now tops the leaderboard after six matches .
there were also victories for michael van gerwen , raymond van barneveld and gary anderson .
author: Brenner Woolley
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

documents.title: norwich city fans call for clarity
text: norwich city return to carrow road on saturday for a championship clash with blackburn rovers after a bad week on the road .
a 5-1 defeat at sheffield wednesday followed by a 1-1 draw at struggling bristol city has left any realistic hopes of a play-off place in tatters .
the canaries have won just one of their last seven games .
the canaries trust , a group which represents some fans , has e-mailed the club to ask for justification from the board if manager alex neil is to remain in the job .
robin sainty from the trust said : `` i think the fans have a right to know .
if they 're going to keep alex neil until the end of the season , fine , what 's the problem in saying that ? ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: defective train track causes disruption
text: rail passengers in on the east anglian mainline face delays due to a defective track between stratford and liverpool street in east london .
greater anglia said services may be cancelled or delayed by up to 20 minutes .
it said the disruption is expected to last until the end of the day .
due to two speed restrictions over defective track near liv street , ga trains between stratford & # liverpoolst have a reduced service .

documents.title: transport secretary : fiveways lights will please frustrated drivers
text: the transport secretary says today 's announcement that traffic lights will be installed on the a11 fiveways roundabout near mildenhall will make a big difference to the thousands of drivers who use it every day .
chris grayling told the bbc `` this will address a frustration which has been felt by motorists in east anglia for a long time '' .
`` this is a junction which has seen congestion too often and the work will smooth the flow of traffic through it , '' he said .
the £ 400,000 project is part of £ 2.4m pot of funding made available this morning for smaller road projects across east anglia following wednesday 's budget .
the other projects which are being funded have n't been named yet .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

text: it 'll be a chilly start to the day but during the morning , milder air will push in and cloud will thicken .
for many it will stay dry today but there is a chance of a spot of rain at times with a high of 11c ( 52f ) .

documents.title: traffic lights for barton mills roundbaout
text: traffic lights are to be installed at the fiveways roundabout on the a11 at barton mills .
the government has announced that work on the £ 400,000 scheme will start in autumn 2018 and should be complete by the following spring .
it follows a long campaign by local residents and motorists who 've complained about frequent accidents on the roundabout and congestion at peak times .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: a10 crash victim named as norfolk man
text: police have named the man who died in a collision on the a10 near cambridge this morning .
he was anthony bradshaw , 51 , of fir road in thetford in norfolk .
he was driving a silver citroen c4 near milton at about 08:25 , when he was in collision with a blue nissan micra .
police are asking for witnesses to contact officers by calling 101 .

documents.title: weybread trial : case adjourned until monday
text: the trial of a man who denies being ali qazimaj , formerly of tilbury in essex , who 's accused of the murder of peter and sylvia stuart from weybread , has been adjourned until monday morning .
judge mr justice jeremy stuart-smith will resume his summing up of the case at ipswich crown court then .
mr qazimaj denies two charges of murder on the grounds that he is actually another albanian man called vital dapi .

documents.title: boatbuilding college plays its part in chelsea display
text: work is going on at the international boatbuilding training college in lowestoft , to create the centrepiece of a display for this year 's chelsea flower show .
in 2013 , a medieval boat , built of oak , was discovered on the norfolk broads .
now a three-quarter size replica is being built , which will be surrounded by plants and trees , at the world famous flower show .

gary breeze , the man behind the project , said : `` one of the things i had to do was take the archaeologists drawings which were just images of broken bits of wood , and turn it into a shape we can make something out of .
`` we had to produce all those line drawings first . ''
author: Guy Campbell
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: framework for redevelopment of anglia square in norwich
text: plans to redevelop anglia square in norwich could move a step closer if a framework is agreed by councillors next week .
the owner of the site , columbia threadneedle , is looking at ways to develop the ageing shopping precinct , which includes derelict office blocks that have been empty for more than 20 years .
the city council 's cabinet , which meets on wednesday , is being recommended to support guidelines which aim to help developers with any proposals for the site .
cabinet member for the environment , bert bremner , said : `` we 've drawn up a framework to get to the next stage , but it does not pre-determine anything .
`` we 're positive about this because a redevelopment would make a big difference to this part of the city and norwich as a whole . ''
the plans could see new retail shops , office space and more than 1,000 new homes .
the next step will see the developers submitting plans to the council .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: darts : wright aiming to extend winning streak
text: suffolk darts player peter wright returns to the oche for the first time tonight since winning the uk open at the weekend .
the 46-year-old from mendham is up against james wade in the sixth round of this season 's premier league , in glasgow .
the event sees world number one michael van gerwen make his return from a back injury - he 's up against kim huybrechts .

documents.title: from the archives : royal norfolk troops training in gas masks 1936
text: eighty one years ago this month , soldiers of the royal norfolk regiment were photographed training at aldershot , hampshire , getting used to revolver shooting while wearing a gas mask .

documents.title: weybread trial : peter stuart 's body had nine stab wounds
text: the judge at ipswich crown court overseeing the trial of a man accused of the murder of peter and sylvia stuart from weybread has referred in his summing up to the discovery of the body of mr stuart on the evening of 3 june .
police found the body in woodland next to the home he shared with his wife sylvia on mill lane .
he had nine stab wounds , eight of which could have been fatal .
the two largest were 15.5 cm ( 6 in ) and 13 cm ( 5 in ) and were consistent with the use of one weapon .
mrs stuart 's body has never been found , but a silver citroen c3 car , found in dover on 5 june , contained five grey hairs matching the dna profile of sylvia stuart .

the vehicle was registered to mr qazimaj and was found to have fingerprints which a forensics expert matched to him , although the defendant says either the prints were the result of a mix-up or that he shares identical fingerprints with someone else .

the court has also heard about automatic number plate recognition evidence linking the citroen registered to mr qazimaj , who lived in tilbury in south essex , to a camera at little stonham on the a140 in suffolk on a number of occasions .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weybread trial : 'defendant conducted internet search for stuarts ' home '
text: as judge mr justice jeremy stuart-smith continues his summing up in the trial of a man the prosecution claim is ali qazimaj , he referred to a laptop used by mr qazimaj from his workplace , which had conducted an internet search for the cottage owned by peter and sylvia stuart , in mill lane , weybread .
the judge at ipswich crown court also referred to events prior to the revelation that peter and sylvia stuart were missing .
two searches for the couple were carried out after they twice failed to turn up for their line-dancing class .
the couple 's daughter , christy paxman , asked friends to go to her parents ' house to look for them , but when there was no sign , she called hospitals , and then the police .
the defendant denies the murder of peter stuart , whose body was found on 3 june close to his home , and sylvia stuart , whose body has not been found , on the grounds that he is not ali qazimaj .

documents.title: search after norfolk police officer assaulted
text: police in norfolk are still searching for a man who is alleged to have assaulted an officer in dereham yesterday .
the driver was stopped by police on sus of drink driving in norwich road at about 11:30 .
he allegedly kicked an officer in the groin before running off .
two other people inside the car have been released without charge .

documents.title: alleged defendant 'liked to shock ' , judge reminds jury
text: the judge also reminded the jury at ipswich crown court of the evidence given by sidney paxman , who was the uncle of peter and sylvia stuart 's son-in-law steve paxman .
the prosecution say the defendant is ali qazimaj , who was a carer for sidney paxman .

mr justice jeremy stuart-smith said the uncle had told the court mr qazimaj could be an `` annoying person '' who liked to shock people , had english `` as good as his '' and had claimed to be an interpreter working for mi5 .
the judge reminded the court that another witness mr qazimaj had worked with in essex had been told by mr qazimaj that he was planning a robbery at a house in or near ipswich .
this afternoon , the judge is due to continue his summing up after a month of evidence .

documents.title: weybread murders : trial hears of dead couple 's house plans
text: during his summing-up in the trial of the man prosecutors claim is ali qazimaj from tilbury
mr justice jeremy stuart-smith reminded jurors of the evidence heard from the dead couple 's daughter christy paxman .
she painted a of her father peter stuart as a `` workaholic '' who worked double shifts at tate & lyle , while her mother sylvia stuart was a `` home-maker '' .
ms paxman and her husband steve paxman had been living with the stuarts in weybread , but were planning on moving to leicestershire , where steve had a new job .
the judge said the stuarts had also been looking at properties in the midlands , but had not put their suffolk home on the market .
earlier in the trial , christy paxman said a mystery man had approached her father in his garden and said `` i understand you want to sell up ?
prosecutors have said ali qazimaj had been a carer for steve paxman 's uncle near mr qazimaj 's home in tibury , south essex .

the defendant denies murder on the grounds that he is not ali qazimaj , but he is actually another albanian national called vital dapi , who had never been to the uk until his arrest and extradition from luxembourg .
the trial continues .

documents.title: scheme to bring together organisations to tackle domestic abuse in norfolk
text: a scheme to help children and families who have suffered domestic abuse in norfolk has secured £ 2m of big lottery funding over five years , says a report to councillors .

on tuesday , norfolk county council 's children services committee will look at how the money can be spent on projects such as fostering co-operation between council children 's services , police and health services .
it will also provide support to `` safeguard vulnerable people at the earliest opportunity '' and `` integrate safeguarding chidlren and domestic abuse referrals '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: the comebacks that have given us joy
text: the comebacks that have given us joy

documents.title: norwich novelist praises women 's fiction prize
text: norwich novelist eimear mcbride , who 's in the running for the prestigious £ 30,000 .
bailey 's women 's prize for fiction , says it is an important award `` when women 's struggle for equality has never been more threatened '' .
mcbride .
( who in 2014 won the prize with her novel a girl is a half-formed thing , has been long-listed for the prize , this year for her novel the lesser bohemians .
today she told the bbc : `` i 'm delighted the lesser bohemians has been long-listed .

`` it 's a book that means a great deal to me and to have attention brought to it by this prize this year particularly , when women 's struggle for equality has never been more threatened , makes me very proud . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: weybread trial : judge tells jury to 'put emotions to one side '
text: the judge at the trial of a man accused of the murder of peter and sylvia stuart ( has told the jury to put emotions to one side in the case of the stuarts , and consider what has been presented .
`` you will decide this by taking into account which evidence is reliable '' , he tells jurors .
`` it 's quite possible for a witness to be right on some things and not on others and if you reject one piece of evidence that does n't mean that the whole case will fall apart . ''
jurors were also told they need to consider that the defendant decided to give evidence , which was his choice , and his evidence must be considered equally to other evidence presented to the court .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weybread trial : closing speeches draw to a close
text: closing speeches in the case of the man accused of the murder of weybread couple peter and sylvia stuart have drawn to a close at ipswich crown court .
the prosecution says a man called ali qazimaj , who lived in tilbury , murdered the couple in the village on the norfolk/suffolk border last year .
mr stuart 's body was found in woodland in june .
mrs stuart has never been found .
the last time the couple were seen alive was when they were shopping in pulham market in norfolk a week earlier .
the man accused says he is actually called vital dapi and denies murder , saying he was not even in the country .
he says he had never even heard of the stuarts until he was arrested in luxembourg .
the jury has been led back into court one for the judge , mr justice jeremy stuart-smith , to begin summing up .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ipswich serviceman attends memorial ceremony in london
text: an former raf medic now living in ipswich is among those invited to a ceremony in london , at which the queen .
has unveiled a memorial to people who have served in iraq and afghanistan since the first gulf war in 1991 .
ian ewers-larose served for 12 years service as an raf medic , serving in the falkands for a period and seeing action on operation granby in the 1st gulf war .
ian , who later fell ill with chronic fatigue syndrome , thinks the event will bring up a lot of memories .
`` at coltishall [ former raf coltishall .
in norfolk ] we were put onto alert incredibly quickly and we had a number of medical kits to get sorted , restocked and absolutely ready to go on aircraft at very very short notice '' , he said .
`` i can remember working through the night , several nights actually , trying to get the kits up ready to go because we had to take everything with us . ''

documents.title: norwich author sarah perry 'thrilled ' to be on women 's fiction prize longlist
text: a norwich author has said she is `` thrilled '' to be in the running for the prestigious £ 30,000 .
bailey 's women 's prize for fiction , previously known as the orange prize .
sarah perry 's novel the essex serpent ( inspired by tales about a serpent from 17th century henham in essex , is one of 16 on the longlist .
perry , who grew up in the chelmsford area , told the bbc : `` it 's absolutely wonderful to be longlisted for a prize with such a noble history of rewarding women 's writing .
`` i 'm thrilled to be there alongside both women writers i 've admired for years , and new writers whose work i 've been delighted to see thrive this year . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: weybread murders trial : judge due to start summing up later
text: i 'm at ipswich crown court , where the defence is presenting its closing speech in the trial of a man accused of murdering peter and sylvia stuart , who lived at weybread near harleston .
the couple were reported missing from their house on 3 june and mr stuart 's body was found later that day in neighbouring woodland .
the last recorded sighting of them alive was at a farm shop in pulham market on 29 may .
mrs stuart 's body has not been found and she is presumed dead .
a man who prosecutors say is ali qazimaj , 43 , from albania and formerly of tilbury in essex , is in the dock .
he denies murder and denies he is ali quazimaj , claiming he is a 44-year-old albanian called vital dapi .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

text: three writers , who live in norwich , are in the running for the prestigious £ 30,000 bailey 's women 's prize for fiction , which was previously known as the orange prize for fiction .

the lesser bohemians by eimear mcbride ( above ) , sarah perry 's the essex serpent , and the gustav sonatas by rose tremain ( below ) , who has homes in london and norwich , are on the 16-strong longlist for the award .
perry ( below ) , who grew up in the chelmsford area , has also already won the .
waterstones book of the year prize .

tessa ross , chair of judges , said : `` the judges had an unusually large number of books of extraordinary quality to choose from this year , and so i ca n't say that it was an easy process to come up with a list as short as sixteen . ''

he was arrested at an address in norwich in the early hours of this morning and will be returned to the prison system .

documents.title: former care home to become dementia unit
text: more good news for dementia sufferers and their families .
a care home due to be sold off in norwich is instead being revamped for people with dementia .
mountfield was one of four homes owned by the county council which closed last year so residents could be moved to the new larger bowthorpe care village .

norse care , a county council firm , raised £ 2m from the sale of three homes but it decided to keep mountfield in north norwich , after discovering the dementia unit at bowthorpe already had a waiting list .
now mountfield will be refurbished and reopened at the end of 2018 , specifically for people with dementia .
karen knights , from norse care , said : `` we 'll be modernising the rooms and making sure it 's fit for people with dementia . ''
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: rare gold coin theft could have added to major uk find
text: more now on the police officer jailed for 16 months for the theft of rare gold coins .
ipswich crown court heard that as well as failing to share the proceeds with the norfolk landowner , david cockle did n't tell him about the find either .
cockle also failed to inform the coroner , instead selling the coins in three small batches to disguise the fact they were from a hoard and treasure trove .
the court heard another metal detectorist had discovered 35 merovingian tremissis coins at the same site but declared them honestly .
had cockle done the same , the discovery would have been the largest find of merovingian coins in the uk , surpassing the discovery of 37 such coins at sutton hoo .
judge rupert overbury said cockle had more than 30 years of experience as a metal detectorist and knew the legal process he should have followed to declare the find .
in a statement for the crown prosecution service , punam malhan said : `` we take heritage crime seriously as it harms the value of our country 's heritage assets for ours and future generations .
`` where a discovery is not recovered , it is felt not just by the owner but by the community as a whole as it can not be replaced . ''
eight of the 10 gold coins from gaul ( france ) were recovered by police and date back to the sixth or seventh centuries .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: former police officer jailed over gold coin theft
text: an officer who was dismissed from norfolk police after being found guilty of the theft of 10 rare medieval gold coins has been jailed for 16 months .
pc david cockle , 51 , found the coins while metal detecting but failed to share proceeds with the landowner , despite agreeing a 50:50 split .
he also failed to declare the find to the coroner .
he was dismissed from his job last month after a police hearing found cockle 's actions amounted to gross misconduct .
as well as the jail term , cockle was issued with a five-year criminal behaviour order which forbids him to engage in metal detecting activity .
the 10 coins found by cockle were known as merovingian tremissis and are similar to the one

documents.title: new home birth service for rural areas praised
text: one of the first mothers to give birth at home with the help of a new service has praised the programme run by the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn .
the new midwife-led scheme officially launched last month and helped diane jeacock give birth to her son william .
mrs jeacock said : `` it meant a lot to be able to give birth in our home .
as i am fit and healthy , i did n't feel the need to be in hospital .
`` for me it was important for the birth to be in my own environment which put me at ease and led to a straight forward delivery .
from the moment he was born william has been a contented baby . ''
the area 's home birthing service was suspended in 2013 after issues with staffing .
now a team of 43 midwives will offer support to women giving birth at home in west norfolk , fenland , boston in lincolnshire and brandon in suffolk .
pregnant women will also have the option of giving birth at the hospital 's waterlily birth centre .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: the budget for the east : good for r & d , bad for self employed
text: as expected , there were hardly any specific announcements for the eastern region in today 's budget ( except , bizarrely , news of a new roundabout in south norfolk ) .
but there 's plenty in the chancellor 's red box which will affect the east .
the extra money for social care will go down well with our county councils and unitary authorities who are struggling to care for a growing elderly population .

business ( particularly pubs ) will welcome the help for those who 're facing large rate increases , while the extra money for triage may help ease a & e pressures on those hospitals of ours which have struggled to cope .
this budget was about preparing britain for brexit , and the east with its numerous science parks should benefit from the extra money going towards science , research and development .
there 'll also be grants to attract the brightest and best in these subjects to study here and more help for north sea gas firms .
but changing national insurance rates for the self employed will not go down well in a region which has traditionally been the home of white van man .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: nine war shells found on beach
text: controlled explosions are being carried out on the beach at holme-next-the-sea .
nine large world war two shells were found by a walker , who alerted the coastguard , as the tide went out .
navy bomb disposal experts are carrying out controlled explosions according to a spokesman from humber coastguard .
the emergency service says each shell is around 18 inches long and very rusty , which adds to the danger they pose .
the area has been cordoned off while the explosions are carried out .

documents.title: charity to fund nurses for dementia patients
text: health officials have confirmed that three areas of norfolk are to get more dementia nurses .
nhs clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) have agreed to co-fund a pilot service with dementia uk for two years .
the number of nhs admiral nurses will rise from two to six and cover norwich , south norfolk and north norfolk .
each ccg has agreed to invest £ 50,000 a year and this will be matched pound for pound by dementia uk , bringing the total investment over two years to £ 300,000 .
zena aldridge , regional .
admiral nurse .

at dementia uk , said : `` i am really pleased that the ccgs in central norfolk have committed to work in partnership with dementia uk to deliver much needed specialist support to families affected by dementia . ''
the news has been welcomed by the mp for north norfolk , norman lamb , who said : `` this is a very welcome partnership between dementia uk and ccgs in norfolk .
i 'm delighted that the ccgs have gone for this . ''
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: work completed early as part of the a12 becomes the a47
text: work to renumber a stretch of the a12 as the a47 , to create a continuous trunk road , has finished ahead of schedule .

the changes mean the a12 between great yarmouth and lowestoft now become part of the a47 , with a continuous trunk road from peterborough to lowestoft , while the a12 is a continuous trunk road between ipswich and london .
highways england said public consultations into major upgrades elsewhere on the a47 , that will start in 2020 , will be announced soon .

documents.title: hairdresser offers 'dry your own hair ' option
text: we seem to be having a plethora of hairdresser stories today .
this one in norwich is also bringing about changes instead of a cut and blow dry , customers are being offered a cut and u-dry !
confused ?
basically you get a hair cut or colour but dry your own hair .
salon owner brian coombes says as well as giving customers more choice it could save them upto 40 % in cash .
mr coombes says stylists will still cut and colour hair , but hopes more customers will come in just to use the salon 's drying facilities - complete with hairdryers , tongs and hair products .
`` people will literally pay for the bit they want done , '' he said .

`` it 's not for everybody because some people like the luxurious experience , but if you just want to maintain your hair , have a root retouch or just a quick trim , we 'll do that bit for you and you can dry it yourself . ''

BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: today 's budget : what 's in it for the region ?
text: in short : probably not much !

the budgets for large infrastructure projects have already been allocated for the next few years and we 're being told that the chancellor wants to hold on to any underspend in case of any adverse side effects from brexit .

today will be largely big stuff but it will impact on all of us : councils will be watching very closely to see if there is any extra money announced for social care , a growing issue across the region , while many shops and firms will wait to see whether the expected back track on business rates is good or bad news .
decisions on fuel duty are always eagerly anticipated in rural areas , increased taxes on alcohol and cigarettes are always easy favourites .
with a large budget deficit and austerity due to continue well into the next decade , do n't expect much good news and be prepared for a bit more belt tightening .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: hairdressers train staff to spot domestic abuse
text: a hair salon in norwich is training staff to spot signs of domestic abuse .
the owner of beau salon in norwich came up with the idea after she became aware of a law being introduced in america which requires hairdressers to undergo training to recognise signs of abuse .

rachel buck , who also works with leeway , a norwich charity helping victims of domestic abuse , says hairdressers are n't being asked to become therapists , just to encourage their clients to get help .

`` when i saw that illinois had brought about a landmark decision to tackle domestic abuse i decided that it would be a good opportunity for me to bring the two areas of my life together , '' she said .
helen burrows , of leeway , said : `` the most dangerous point in a relationship where there 's domestic abuse happening is the point of leaving .
`` so the hairdressers will be able to support that person , explain that this is a dangerous time and that there is help out there . ''
author: Debbie Tubby
BBC Look East

documents.title: women to join national protest over state pension
text: women born in the 1950s who say they 're set to miss out financially because of an increase in the state pension age , from 60 to at least 66 , are joining a protest in london today .
fifty women from a group in norfolk will join more than 5,000 protesting at westminster .
women against state pension inequality ( waspi ) wants the government to rethink changes to the female state pension age .
under the 1995 pensions act , the government decided that the pension ages of both men and women would be equalised by 2020 .
previously , women retired at 60 , while men retired at 65 .
debbie de spon says the state pension age was raised too quickly , leaving `` women like us financially disadvantaged '' .
lynn nichols added : `` there 's about 45,000 norfolk women affected and 2.6 million nationally .
we need to be taken seriously and not treated as a nuisance . ''
the government says there are no plans to change the arrangements in place .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: norwich city let lead slip
text: a lack of quality in both penalty areas was to blame as norwich city threw away their lead to draw 1-1 at relegation threatened bristol city .
winger yanic wildshut scored his first goal for the club to put them in front , but that would be the canaries ' only shot on-target all game .
the hosts grew in confidence and equalised after a scramble from a corner .
norwich boss alex neil said after the match that his side defended poorly and failed to take their opportunities to score .
`` i think the frustrating thing from our point of view is that we had three or four real good chances to break away and our final ball was poor .
`` we could 've finished the game off .
when the goal came in it was tight , it was n't even a header and that 's really frustrating .
i 'd expect us to defend that better . ''

documents.title: farmers 'disappointed ' by tesco decision to drop british grown sugar
text: beet farmers in the region have criticised the supermarket giant tesco for its decision to stop stocking silver spoon granulated sugar in its stores .
the british sugar brand , made from processed sugar beet , has been replaced by rival tate and lyle - which uses imported sugar cane .
the national farmers union has desecribed the move as `` hugely disappointing '' .
norfolk produces a third of the country 's sugar and is the country 's largest sugar beet producer .
british sugar produces its silver spoon brand at sites including bury st edmunds and its central office is in peterborough .
tony bambridge grows the crop near blickling in norfolk and says he wants shoppers to be given a choice .

`` sugar beet is a cornerstone crop for us in this part of the world , so when you go into your local retailer and you find your sugar is not there and the people do n't have the choice to buy the sugar they 're producing is rather sad . ''
tesco says its aim is to provide the best quality and prices for its customers adding that it still stocks some silver spoon products .
imported raw cane sugar will be processed in britain .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 'buy in broadland ' scheme begins
text: a local voucher scheme has begun in broadland .
the buy in broadland discount booklet will go to every household in the district .
the council says it cost them £ 8,044 to produce 60,000 copies which will be posted with the authority 's annual newsletter .
the aim is to get more people buying locally to boost 96 small local businesses and the council says it should help sustain jobs .
councillor stuart clancy said : `` a main ambition of broadland district council is to achieve economic success in the district .
`` with the new buy in broadland booklet , residents will be able to discover new places , remember old favourites and contribute to achieving this ambition . ''

victoria lawrence , of agent shave , which supplies men 's grooming products , said : `` as a new start-up business , this is a fantastic opportunity to be used and recognised in our local community . ''

documents.title: witness appeal after fatal crash
text: police are trying to find witnesses to a car crash that killed a woman on friday evening .
it happened on dulls road in ellingham , near beccles .
the woman who died was in her 20s .
a passenger in the same car - a man also in his 20s - remains in a critical condition at addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .

documents.title: bold new plans for seafront landmark
text: the owners of one of great yarmouth 's major landmarks - the hollywood cinema - have submitted plans for its re-development .
an artist 's impression of what 's projected can be seen below :
jay 's uk , which also own the town 's hippodrome , wants to upgrade the five-screen cinema to include new all-glass restaurant , bar and terrace areas overlooking the sea on the first floor .
peter jay said it will put the building back in its rightful place as one of the `` jewels in the crown of the east coast , if not the whole country '' .
`` it has the best position , a dominating role in the whole great yarmouth seafront landscape and this plan will take it to new heights , '' he said .
the building was erected in 1896 and was once known as the royal aquarium .
the whole building will be cleaned , renovated and lit up at night .

documents.title: accusation of 'suppression ' made in playground row
text: the fight over the future of a play area in wymondham has taken a new twist , according to a local group who want equipment to stay in a park .
wymondham town council tried to close the play area at kings head meadow following complaints about noise .
that prompted a. protest by parents .
last summer who formed a pressure group , the khm playscape working party , which is now accusing three town councillors of `` surpressing vital information '' .
the group says it has information to show the councillors exaggerated the scale of anti-social behaviour allegations and noise levels .
it says they 've shared the findings with the town council .
we asked wymondham town council for a response to the allegations - they told us they would not comment , neither would they confirm if the claims will be discussed at .
tonight 's council meeting .

text: the detective leading the inquiry has been reacting to the life jail sentence given to mark smith , 41 , of philadelphia lane for a string of sex attacks on children between 1985 and 2015 .

det insp dave freeman , from the child abuse investigation unit , said : `` smith is a sexual predator and clearly poses a danger to children , a threat which is reflected in the life sentence imposed by the judge .
`` this was a truly abhorrent case .

documents.title: life sentence for norwich paedophile
text: a norwich man has started a life sentence for raping and abusing children .
mark smith , 41 , of philadelphia lane , pleaded guilty to 29 counts including the indecent assault to rape of a girl under 13 .
the crimes date back to the 1980s and continued until 2015 .
children were abused in both norwich and north yorkshire .
all the children abused were under 14 .
smith has been sentenced to life imprisonment - with an order that he serves at least 16 years .
he was also put on the sex offenders register for life .
police say they hope the sentence gives some closure to the victims .

text: norwich city manager alex neil says his side is currently in a transitional phase .
the scot takes the canaries to championship strugglers bristol city tonight , knowing that promotion to the premier league is looking more and more unlikely .
neil has called on the more experienced members of his squad to step up .
`` we 're sort of in a transitional phase at the moment .
we 've got a lot of older players and now they 've got to show they 're still up to the job and can do all the things we require from them .

it makes no difference , it needs to be resolved . ''

documents.title: budgens : more than 800 jobs lost as 34 stores close
text: a chain of 34 budgens stores has failed to find a buyer and will close , with the loss of more than 800 jobs .
the owner of the stores affected , food retailer operations limited ( frol ) , was put in administration a month ago after hitting `` difficult '' trading conditions .
the stores are spread around the uk , and include two each in cambridgeshire , essex and norfolk .
they were bought from the co-op in 2016 .
the closures do not affect the remainder of the budgens chain , which has more than 150 stores .
the branches affected in the region are :
the budgens brand is owned by wellingborough-based food wholesale giant booker , which is currently in the process of being taken over by tesco .

documents.title: weybread murders : trial drawing to a close
text: i 'm heading to ipswich crown court for the latest in the trial of a man accused of murdering peter and sylvia stuart , who lived at weybread near harleston .
the couple were reported missing from their house on 3 june and mr stuart 's body was found later that day in neighbouring woodland .
the last recorded sighting of them alive was at a farm shop in pulham market on 29 may .
mrs stuart 's body has not been found and she is presumed dead .
a man who prosecutors say is ali qazimaj , 43 , from albania and formerly of tilbury in essex , is in the dock .
he denies murder and denies he is ali quzimaj , claiming he is a 44-year-old albanian called vital dapi .
the trial began four weeks ago and we have heard the .
prosecution and defence cases .
we are expecting closing speeches followed by the judge 's summing up today .

BBC News

documents.title: re-sits costing college thousands
text: further education colleges in norfolk say they 're having to spend thousands of pounds so that students can retake gcses .
rules now dictate that if pupils fail to get at least a c in english or maths they need to resit them until they pass or are 18 .
city college in norwich says it costs them tens of thousands of pounds for students to do re-takes and has had to hire out the norfolk showground for extra space .
the exams themselves cost more than £ 30 a paper .
ray cameron-goodwin of city college says they will have to accomodate some 3,500 students taking maths and english .
lindsay wilson from easton and otley college says the subjects are an easy way for the government to gauge the level of attainment of young people .

she said : `` but really what we should be asking is 'is that qualification fit for purpose for young people who 've not succeeded in school at the grade they would like , but have now decided to pursue a career in a vocational subject ? '
`` what they really need to do is to develop their skills in english and maths in an applied sense . ''
in a statement , the department for education said it 's developing high-quality options for students , to make sure they have the knowledge and skills that employers need .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: investigation after care leaver found living in squalid home
text: an investigation is under way to find out how a vulnerable teenager , supported by social services , ended up living alone in squalid conditions .
it comes after the bbc filmed inside the teenager 's house which was covered in animal droppings , had broken electrical fittings and no bed linen .
the 17-year-old had been placed there by sixteen plus , a private firm norfolk county council uses to support older teens who have left care .
sixteen plus say the allegations come from disgruntled ex-employees and that it was n't providing support at the properties when the were taken .
a norfolk county council spokesman said : we agree that young people should not be living in these conditions .
we are following up the new issues being raised with us urgently , having already followed up those raised with us previously .

`` in addition , we are currently looking at the arrangements for all of our care leavers living in sixteen plus properties to ensure that their accommodation is safe and appropriate in all instances . ''
the authority also confirmed that all care leavers had a social worker or personal advisor to support them into adulthood .
author: BBC Look East

documents.title: the latest news for norfolk on tuesday
text: hello and welcome back to norfolk live .
the team are ready to bring you all the county 's latest news , weather , sport and travel as they happen .
you can keep us posted too in the usual way , via email , twitter or facebook .
have a good day .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: our local coverage for today
text: that 's it compadres from your norfolk live afficionadoes .
not sure why i 've gone all latino on you , but i 'll stick with it and say adios .
before we go a reminder of our top stories today :
buenos noches mes amigas .
the team is back from 08:00 tomorrow but any breaking news overnight will of course drop here .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: mullally gets recording contract with ed sheeran 's label
text: neo-soul singer mullally from belton has signed a record deal with atlantic records .
the singer told the bbc he signed on friday .
the label has boasted a host of famous singers past and present including otis redding , ray charles and ed sheeran as well as rock bands including led zeppelin and yes .
the gorleston-born singer told bbc introducing in norfolk the multiple-album deal was `` crazy '' .
`` who 'd a thunk it , gorleston boy born and bred , i 'm still trying to wrap my head round it .
`` i slept on a sofa in london for 18 months and i 'm 6'2 '' .
`` you put your all into the dream thinking one day you 'll achieve it , success and all that .
it 's unreal . ''
mullally said he was called by ed sheeran who gave him lots of good advice about working for atlantic and getting the best deal out of the relationship..
author: BBC Introducing... in Norfolk

documents.title: take a step back and down historic flint mine
text: a prehistoric attraction near thetford is going to allow us down a new shaft into flint mines later in the year .
a 4,500-year-old mineshaft at grimes graves has had a ladder and a winch installed to take people 12m ( 39ft ) below ground to see the ancient space .
greenwells pit will be made accessible from june to the public - adding to existing access to the mines .
flint mining was one of the most important industries in east anglia for stone age man .
they used them to make spear tips , axes and tools .
marie spampanato , site manager has been explaining how neolithic man might have descended down into the pit in their day :
`` we do n't know for sure , but they could have used tree trunks that had notches and used them up against the wall , like a ladder .
these pits range from 4m deep to 13m deep so it 's a very amazing feat of engineering . ''

documents.title: no decision on homes for dereham
text: a decision to build nearly 300 homes near dereham has been deferred .
homes , new roads and recreation space was proposed at land off shipdham road , westfield road and westfield lane .
breckland council met today , but will not now make a decision until a future meeting .
the local authority received 172 letters of objection to the deveopment .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lost goose goes-a-gandering
text: a goose is on the loose - well not quite .
this goose has been captured and put into a cage while its owner is sought .
the goose landed overnight at maxview ltd in setchey near king 's lynn .
it was discovered by brian dann who 'd gone into the yard first thing .
`` it was hissing at me , but thankfully one of my colleagues keeps birds and knew exactly what to do .
`` once in her arms it became so placid . ''
the firm makes satellite and radio receivers and is hoping the owner will come forward to reclaim the bird which is currently in a cage being fed seed pellets and iceberg lettuce .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: evening weather : chilly overnight
text: showers should become very isolated into this evening and overnight , so it 'll be largely dry with some clear spells .
temperatures may fall low enough to give a patchy frost .
after a chilly start , tomorrow should be largely fine and dry with sunny spells and a few showers in the north-east of the region .
a band of rain is expected to spread in from the west after dark .
highs tomorrow of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: businesses may take on apprentices to 'claim tax back ' , says chamber of commerce
text: businesses in the east are raising concerns about government plans to expand the apprenticeship system by introducing a tax on businesses with a payroll of more than £ 3m .
from april the government is expanding the number of apprenticeships by taxing big businesses to fund training .
they can claim the money back if they take on an apprentice .
paul griffiths , chief executive of northamptonshire chamber of commerce , said many businesses wo n't take on apprentices , and those that do , may not do it for the right reasons .

he said there is a `` possibility '' that some businesses will simply take on apprentices to claim back the extra tax they 've paid to fund the training `` as a means to an end for them so they are n't out of pocket '' .
you can see more on inside out east tonight on bbc one at 19:30 .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: darts : wright wo n't be resting on his laurels
text: it 's business as usual today for suffolk darts player peter wright after last night 's success in the uk open final .
the 46-year-old from mendham beat gerwyn price 11-6 in minehead , to secure the first major title of his career .

`` i 'll travel back and hopefully get back early enough and i 'll be on the practice board , ready for my next tournament , which is the premier league on thursday , against james wade , '' wright said .
author: Brenner Woolley
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

documents.title: primary 'outstanding ' say inspectors
text: there 's praise for a school on the outskirts of norwich where it 's said pupils have a passion for learning .
ofsted inspectors were impressed when they visited cringleford primary last month and rated it outstanding across the board .
officials say classrooms at cringleford are `` calm yet purposeful '' .
the report said pupils make excellent and consistent progress from their arrival in reception and their attainment is high .
staff are described as a very effective team , while pupils have great enthusiasm for learning and enjoy coming to school .
attendance is well above the national average and behaviour was rated as outstanding with pupils getting on well together .
when asked one parent said : `` our children thrive here .
we could n't ask any more from a school and are proud to call it ours ''
author: Amy Barratt
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: robbery at norwich chippie
text: police are searching for man who broke into a fish and chip shop in norwich , tied up a worker and stole a large amount of cash .
it happened in the orford plaice fish and chip shop , on orford place in the city centre , at about 07:00 on friday .
the victim was in the basement when a man entered and tied him up to a metal post .
he then took all the cash from the staff member 's pockets .
the suspect is described as white , 5ft 10 inches to 6ft tall , of slim build , and was wearing a green parka with the hood up , black trousers and black lace up shoes .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: motorcyclist dies after crash on friday
text: a motorcyclist has died as a result of injuries he had after he hit a fence in brandon on friday afternoon .
the accident happened shortly before 17:15 at a property on green road near to the junction with blackbird avenue .
the man , who is in his 50s but is not being named by suffolk police , died in addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge on sunday .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: charity fund-raising for county 's first lymphoma psychologist
text: a charity says a psychologist could make a big difference for people with cancer in norfolk .
the lymphoma association wants to raise £ 20,000 to pay for the post for the county .
lymphoma is the fifth most common cancer in the uk , after breast , lung , colon and prostate cancers .
it is the most common form of blood cancer .
the charity 's chief executive , jonathan pearce , says a lot of people would be given extra help to deal with the mental health aspects of the disease .
`` we 're hoping that once up-and-running we can support about 120 people in the first year and that will show the evidence that this makes a real difference , '' said mr pearce .
`` we 've already been told by the patients we 've supported in the past that there 's a gap in nhs services around clinical psychology . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: soup kitchen volunteers attacked
text: volunteers who run a soup kitchen in great yarmouth say they 'll continue the service despite being attacked on friday .
two men have been questioned by norfolk police over what happened outside market gates shopping centre .
they 've been released pending further inquiries .
dave cosby , one of the volunteers from the tribal trust who was injured , says a few ended up hurt .
`` it got quiet scary - i had my head down and got punched and kicked .
gary got injured as well and one of the homeless lads who came in to help got kicked to the floor . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: disruption to rail services
text: trains between norwich and london are currently being cancelled after someone was hit by a train .
it happened near chelmsford .
greater anglia says services may be back to normal , but is urging people to check before they travel .
so far four services have been cancelled .

documents.title: clock tower to get a face lift
text: repair work starts today on one of the best known buildings in norfolk .
the clock tower on city hall in norwich is being covered in scaffolding so that the long pieces of metal 'finials ' can be cleaned and restored .
re-pointing work will also be carried out .
the art deco landmark is being repaired at a cost £ 200,000 .
the work is expected to take about 14 weeks and the clock will be turned off while the work is carried out .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: £ 620k a-road junction work gets under way
text: work starts on building a new roundabout at the junction of the a148 and b1436 at felbrigg near cromer .
it 's costing £ 619,000 to improve the junction on the main cromer to holt road .
the work is expected to take 12 weeks to complete so the new roundabout should be in place by the end of may .
funding for the project has come from a variety of sources including local councils and partnerships .
the new roundabout means the junction will be much easier to negotiate , safer , and encourage vehicles that do not need to stop in cromer to bypass it and cut congestion in the town ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 'i just pulled the throttle and it went ' says convicted 132mph biker
text: pawel lewinski told norwich magistrates ' court : `` sorry , but i just pulled the throttle and it went .
it 's so easy . ''
as well as the six-month ban , he has to pay £ 475 in costs and fines .
sentencing him , paul allen jp , said : `` you have been a fool , to say the least .
`` it 's wholly unacceptable on any road in this country - it might be acceptable on a german autobahn , but not here . ''
the court heard lewinski , a german , had been living in the uk for 11 years .

documents.title: six-month ban for biker caught doing 130mph
text: a motorcyclist has been banned from riding for six months after admitted to speeding on the a140 at 132mph ( 212 km/h ) .
pawel lewinski , 36 , from wordsworth road in diss , was clocked by police on the dual carriageway at scole , which has a 70mph ( 110km/h ) speed limit .
the german engineer , who works in eye , was riding a kawasaki zx 1000 c2h at about 14:30 on thursday , 18 august last year .
he also admitted not having a valid driving licence .
norwich magistrates ' court heard he had an eu licence , but prosecutors said drivers/riders have to apply for a uk one if they 've lived here for more than a year .

documents.title: breaking speeding biker banned after being clocked at 132mph on a-road
text: a motorcyclist has been banned from the road for six months after being caught speeding on the a140 .
more to follow

documents.title: biker , caught at 130mph on a-road , due to be sentenced
text: i 'm heading to norwich magistrates ' court where a motorcyclist is due to be sentenced after being clocked at 132mph on a dual carriageway .
pawel lewinski , 36 , from wordsworth road in diss , has already admitted speeding on the a140 at scole on 18 june last year .
he 's also admitted riding the kawasaki zx 1000 c2h without a valid licence .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: air pollution exceeding safe limits in parts of county
text: ten sites across norfolk have been identified where pollution exceeds legal eu limits .
they 're all in norwich or king 's lynn and include castle meadow in norwich , where a lot of buses pass through , and railway road in lynn .
the information published by the .
department of environment and rural afairs .
( defra ) shows there were unsafe levels of nitrogen dioxide at sites across the county in 2015 .
norwich city council has been implementing measures since 2015 to .
reduce air pollution .
in the city centre .
it comes as the world health organisation ( who ) warns air pollution is `` one of the most pernicious threats '' facing global public health today .
dirty air does n't directly kill people .
but it 's estimated in the uk to contribute to the .
shortening of the lives of around 40,000 people a year , principally by undermining the health of people with heart or lung problems .
the bbc 's .
so i can breath .
week is looking at ways in which we can tackle air pollution .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 55,000 ducks culled after bird flu outbreak
text: about 55,000 ducks have been culled after a bird flu outbreak at a farm on the norfolk/suffolk border .
the h5n8 virus was detected at grange farm in redgrave , near diss , which is run by gressingham foods .
defra said no birds were infected , but they were culled over the weekend as a precaution .

documents.title: alex neil : better is needed in norwich promotion chase
text: norwich city manager alex neil says his side have `` no chance '' of promotion if they continue to perform like they did at the weekend .
the canaries were hammered 5-1 at play-off rivals sheffield wednesday , adding to their dreadful away record .
city could have been three points off sixth-placed wednesday if they had they won , but instead they 're nine points adrift and facing an uphill struggle to reach the play-offs .
neil said : `` it 's still achievable .
if we were in really good form we 'd be thinking 'let 's keep on winning ' .
`` the bottom line is if we perform like that [ saturday 's defeat ] , there is no chance .
`` if we perform as we think and expect and hope that we can , then we 've got a chance .
but it 'd have to improve pretty quickly . ''
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: canary striker : 'norwich lack respect for coaches and each other '
text: norwich city forward cameron jerome has accused his team mates of lacking respect for each other .
the canaries produced another dreadful away performance on saturday , losing 5-1 at play-off rivals sheffield wednesday .
the defeat means city are nine points adrift of the owls who are in sixth place in the championship .
jerome says the norwich squad need to hold their hands up : `` as players we 're not honest with ourselves .
`` i think we lack respect for our team mates , we 're not fighting for each other .
`` we lack respect for the coaching staff and all the things they do for us .
we 're not following instructions or orders - it 's like everyone plays for themselves . ''
norwich are back in action tomorrow night at bristol city .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: clive lewis : fraudster behind fake labour leadership bid websites
text: the labour mp for norwich south says an activist from another political party has been setting up websites in his name - to give the impression he wants to run as party leader .
clive lewis said it would be `` foolish to say never '' to the possibility , but that he backed jeremy corbyn .
at the weekend it was revealed that two websites with the addresses clive for leader.org and clive for leader.co.uk had been created and mr lewis was once again forced to deny that he was plotting .
now he 's revealed that he 's employed a firm of solicitors to investigate and their initial findings suggest that a known activist from another political party was behind the move .
mr lewis wo n't give any more details for now , but he 's once again reiterated his support for jeremy corbyn and he says there 's a lot of mischievous behaviour around .
mr lewis has .
also said .
he planned to `` have a cup of tea '' with corbyn 's arch critic lord mandelson .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: darts : wright secures first major title
text: suffolk darts player peter wright is the 2017 uk open champion .
the 46-year-old from mendham , who 's been runner-up the last two years , beat welshman gerwyn price 11-6 in yesterday 's final in minehead .
`` obviously i feel great to win my first one , '' said wright .
`` i do n't want to put a downer on it , but we had no michael ( van gerwen ) or phil ( taylor ) here , but i still had the pressure of being favourite . ''
author: Brenner Woolley
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

we 'll be bringing you all the news , travel , weather and sport from the county until 18:00 .
but first we 'll have the all-important weather forecast .
